title: MoodTunes
description: An app that analyzes facial expressions to generate personalized Spotify playlists based on mood.
about: MoodTunes is an innovative application utilizing the Spotify API and the Face API to create tailored playlists according to users' emotions and musical preferences.
other: Originally conceived during a school project, MoodTunes emerged from a collaborative effort, inspired by the fusion of technology and emotions.

images.name: Home page
images.description: The MoodTunes homepage displaying the login screen

images.name: Logged in
images.description: When logged in, the app welcomes you with your name and profile picture.

images.name: Sad playlist
images.description: Generated playlist based on the user's mood. In this case, a sad playlist was generated.

images.name: Happy playlist
images.description: Generated playlist based on the user's mood. In this case, a happy playlist was generated.

title: Painter API
description: An API showcasing old painters and their artwork, like an Instagram for old painters.
about: This project was born during my internship, and it's all about celebrating the works of old painters. Think of it as an Instagram for old painters! I developed this API using Spring Boot and Java, putting my skills to the test. It provides various endpoints to manage painters and their artwork, allowing you to explore and interact with their masterpieces.
other: Developing this API was a fantastic opportunity for me to dive into the world of web development and showcase my abilities with Spring Boot and Java. It was a labor of love, and I hope it sparks your interest in the remarkable works of old painters!

title: Exam - New Webshop Design
description: Improved webshop design, developed based on research and analysis report.
about: During my fourth-year internship at Yonder Tilburg, in collaboration with KCPerformance, I was tasked with improving their webshop. Initially, this was supposed to be done through Upwork, a platform for hiring freelancers, specifically a Shopify developer, as I had no prior experience with Shopify. KCPerformance already had an existing webshop, but it faced multiple issues, which led to the decision to create a new one. Since I was unfamiliar with the webshop and its problems, I decided to conduct a thorough analysis. I researched and documented the webshop’s structure and its pain points [1], allowing me to gain a clear understanding of the existing situation.
other: For the research and analysis, I mainly examined other webshops, focusing on visual analysis and identifying trends. While this approach was valuable, I realize that a more in-depth logical analysis would have been beneficial for future projects. The design process itself was less structured than I would have liked. Although I am satisfied with the final result—a wireframe [2] and a completed design [3]—I wish I had spent more time researching how successful webshops function and perform well on Google before starting the design process. After completing my designs, I received feedback, which I documented and carefully considered for possible improvements [4].

images.name: Mobile Hompage Design
images.description: The KCPerformance webshop mobile homepage design

title: Spotify Record Player
description: A project that displays your currently playing Spotify song, inspired by the aesthetic of a record player.
about: As a huge music lover, I'm always jamming to my favorite tunes. However, I don't have all the records I'd like to see spinning on a turntable. That's why I created this app using Angular and the Spotify Web API. It allows you to log in to your Spotify account and shows you the song you're currently playing, giving you that nostalgic feeling of watching a record spin on a turntable.
other: I'm incredibly proud of this project. It was a fantastic opportunity to combine my passion for music with my development skills. Along the way, I gained valuable knowledge about Spotify authentication and exploring the Spotify Web API. Now I can groove to my favorite tracks and enjoy the aesthetics of a virtual record player!

title: Projects Portfolio
description: A portfolio website to showcase all of my projects.
about: This is the website you are currently on. I made this website to showcase my projects. The structure of the project has 2 core components: The list of projects, and the project page.
other: I coded this project with the idea to get everything from the json file (like an API response). The project link sends an id, and the project page handels all the data.

images.name: Json
images.description: A snippet of the json file that holds all the project data.

title: Spotlight Cinema
description: An app designed for a cinema, browse movies, book tickets, and participate in movie voting for the next screening.
about: Spotlight Cinema was a captivating project where we transformed a pre-designed concept into a functional cinema app. With a focus on frontend development, the app offered users the ability to explore movie listings, reserve tickets, and engage in an intriguing feature: movie voting. This unique feature empowered users to influence the next week's movie screening by voting for their preferred film. Designed to cater to movie enthusiasts who struggle with choosing a movie, Spotlight Cinema provided a solution while enhancing user engagement.
other: Utilizing the provided API, we seamlessly integrated backend functionality into the app. Spotlight Cinema was a testament to our frontend development skills, showcasing our ability to bring designs to life and create an immersive user experience.

title: Jarpis Internship
description: A year-long internship at Jarpis, where I worked on various projects and gained valuable experience.
about: During my internship at Jarpis, I had the opportunity to work on a wide range of projects, each offering unique challenges and learning experiences. I was involved in developing web applications, creating APIs, and contributing to the front-end and back-end of various projects. My time at Jarpis was incredibly rewarding, allowing me to grow as a developer and gain valuable insights into the industry.
other: My internship at Jarpis was a pivotal experience that shaped my skills and knowledge as a developer. I'm grateful for the opportunity to work on diverse projects and collaborate with talented professionals. It was a year of growth, learning, and unforgettable memories.

images.name: Jarpis BV
images.description: The company where I did my internship at

images.name: Desk setup
images.description: The place where I spend most of my time during my internship at Jarpis

title: Anna Housing
description: A website for Anna Housing showcasing a house in Scheveningen.
about: I developed this website for Anna Housing using Angular. The design of the website is clean and modern, with a focus on simplicity and elegance. I built the entire website from scratch, including the design, layout, and functionality. One of the notable features of the website is the integration of EmailJS, which allows visitors to send inquiries directly from the website.
other: This project was one of my first paid Angular websites, and it provided me with valuable experience in working with Angular and implementing client-side functionality. I thoroughly enjoyed creating this website and delivering a high-quality product to Anna Housing.
